group_1.textLeft: And here's my school!
I always struggled to fit in with everyone else,@so I don't have any good memories of that time…
But I do have one from when we ruined this@place together.
They scrubbed away all the graffiti,
and our names on the chalkboard are gone…
Well, that's to be expected… Ahaha.

group_1.textRight: …Hanna and Sena. That's what I wrote, yeah?

group_1.textLeft: That's right. I'm glad you remember…
Huh? About me being glad?

group_1.textRight: I think that was all we needed to say.

group_1.textLeft: Y-yeah… Right.

group_1.narration: After that, we went to many places.
It was less us revisiting our memories@and more like revisiting our crime scenes…@Which was just right for us.
We did many terrible things@and made many people unhappy.
That means…we ought to have a bad ending too.@We should be destroyed.
But if I could be forgiven for being selfish for@a little while, and be given a beautiful ending…
Then I'd want to be buried alive and@suffocate in my memories with Hanna,@at the end of a world where no one else exists.
I'd want the end to come on@that wonderful Christmas.
…That's right. Not a single good thing has@ever happened to me on Christmas.@So I can be forgiven for at least this, can't I…?
"...Found you, Mikoto."

group_1.textLeft: *Gasp*

group_1.textRight: Wh-what's up? You froze up all of a sudden…

group_1.textLeft: …The apartment complex?

group_1.textRight: Oh yeah, you mean that one?

group_1.textLeft: …Why did we come here? I didn't mean to…
No, it's just…I used to live in that complex.
See, Hanna? You've come here before, right?
…Oh, right…@I never actually showed you my real home.
Say, Hanna…@Do you like Christmas?
…I hate it.

group_1.textRight: My parents were useless. I don't have any@good memories of that day.
We're in the same boat, Sena.

group_1.textLeft: Hanna…

group_1.textRight: Before we get outta town… Head in there and@say whatever you need to say one last time.

group_1.textLeft: I don't need to.@Mom doesn't live there anymore.
She thinks I'm dead anyway…
Hanna?
HANNA!

group_1.narration: Hanna can't keep up with all these sudden@circumstances. Is she going to become a Witch?@No… First of all, we're just Uwasa.@We aren't concerned with becoming Witches.
Hanna is unconscious and lying on the ground…@Something gross is floating around,@seemingly flowing into her…
Maybe… Is it because of Hanna's [textBlue:Rumor]?
I wrote her [textBlue:Rumor]'s rebellion to be "built on"@resentment towards society and the world, but is@the wording making her absorb anger and hatred?

group_1.textCenter: N-no…that's not what I meant. That bit was just@supposed to represent our memories together…
What should I do? This is all my fault…@This is all my fault, Hanna…!
No way…@I...I have to figure out how to fix this!

group_1.narration: …Wait, there is one thing…@I couldn't use my magic like this before,@but with the Uwasa's power…
Right, I can take the anger and hatred that's@torturing Hanna and transplant it into me.
A dirty, disgusting feeling is filling me…@A different sensation than accumulating despair.@It's like the feeling of being under a Witch's@influence, tainted with the will to destroy.
If that's all it is…then good.@I can handle it.@I don't want Hanna to feel like I did.
Something bad accumulates in my Uwasa…@Anger and hatred…@Could this malice be some kind of power?@Then there came a sudden, uncontrollable surge@of energy that vanished as if it were absorbed…

group_1.textCenter: This… I will make it my power.
My power as an Uwasa's persona…

group_1.textLeft: Oh, you came to.
The rooftop of the housing complex.@We can't be seen here.
It was suuuper hard carrying you on my back,@you know.
What do you mean?

group_1.textRight: …If you're not gonna talk, I'm not gonna ask.
But…if you can't handle it all alone,@you've got me…

group_1.textLeft: What are you talking about?@I'm perfectly fine.
I'm used to staying still.@Go back to sleep, Hanna.
Geeze! Then go to sleep already!
…Heeeey, Hannaaaa.
…She really is asleep…@She must've been in a lot of pain…
I'm glad I was able to help her…but…

group_1.narration: "Why am I here?"

group_1.textLeft: I remember… We were revisiting our memories@and passed by an apartment complex…

group_1.narration: …There are moments where my memory@gets hazy. I think these are the times@when the Uwasa's persona has awoken.
Like Hanna, the Uwasa implanted into me@has a persona, but it was still dormant…
After storing up all my magic while in Iroha,@I possessed more power than it,@so I was able to wrest control.
But after treating the malice within Hanna@like magic and transplanting it into myself,@it sparked something in the Uwasa's@persona and woke it up.
Even now, the Uwasa is fighting to take back control…@But for me to tamp it down, I have to use my magic.

But of course, it also costs magic for me to@keep Iroha and Nemu trapped in the "Rumor of@the Endless Mirrors"... It'd be perfectly fine@if that was all I needed to do, but together@with this other factor consuming my magic…
I've grown weak, and my memories are@being clouded by the Uwasa's persona…@It's probably something like that.
At this rate…everything might be obscured…@Even my memories of Hanna…
And for my memories to be obscured…@That's no different than forgetting them…

group_1.textLeft: …I'm scared…@I'm scared, Hanna…

group_1.narration: Whatever happens,@please don't let me forget about Hanna.
I don't want to forget.@I don't want to forget Hanna…@No, no…I don't want to forget…!
But even now…I'm still transplanting the malice@swarming around Hanna into my being…
Because I know how I used to be, obsessed@with destruction without understanding why…@And that made me even more afraid@that Hanna would forget about me…
